net.objectzoo.events.impl
Class EventAsyncDistributor<T>

java.lang.Object
  net.objectzoo.events.impl.EventDistributor<T>
      net.objectzoo.events.impl.EventAsyncDistributor<T>
Type Parameters:
T - The type of the information parameter the event provides
All Implemented Interfaces:
Action<T>, ActionAsync<T>, Event<T>
public class EventAsyncDistributor<T>
extends EventDistributor<T>
implements Event<T>, ActionAsync<T>

The EventAsyncDistributor is a helper class that encapsulates all the logic required to provide events in other classes that invoke their subscribers asynchronously. The EventAsyncDistributor implements the Event interface to allow subscription and the Action and ActionAsync interface to allow invocations to be distributed to all subscribers either synchronously or asynchronously. Subscriber invocations are performed in the order of subscription. All asynchronous event distributions are executed in another thread. The Executor to use for the asynchronous event distributions can be chosen during creation of this helper. If no explicit executor is given the a default executor is used. The default executor can be set using the AsyncExecutor.setDefaultExecutor(Executor) property or is created automatically by the AsyncExecutor.

Author:
tilmann

Method Detail

beginInvoke

public ActionAsyncResult beginInvoke(ActionAsyncCallback callback,
                                     Object asyncState,
                                     T parameter)
This beginInvoke implementation invokes all event subscribers in another thread in the order they have been subscribed.

Specified by:
beginInvoke in interface ActionAsync<T>
Parameters:
callback - the ActionAsyncCallback, if given to beginInvoke, is invoked upon completion of invocation of all event subscribers and receives the same ActionAsyncResult that is returned by the call to beginInvoke.
asyncState - the asyncState is an arbitrary reference that, if given to beginInvoke, can be retrieved from this invocations ActionAsyncResult.getAsyncState()
parameter - the parameter to invoke the subscribers with
Returns:
the ActionAsyncResult associated with this asynchronous invocation
